alert.note: Alert for Alamosa; Conejos; Costilla; Rio Grande; Saguache (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 12 at 6:04PM MST until December 12 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Western Alamosa County in southeastern Colorado... Southeastern Rio Grande County in south central Colorado... Southeastern Saguache County in central Colorado... Southwestern Costilla County in south central Colorado... Conejos County in south central Colorado... * Until 700 PM MST. * At 603 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Del Norte to near Capulin to 14 miles south of Antonito, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Alamosa, Monte Vista, Manassa, Sanford, La Jara, Antonito, Romeo, Alamosa East, Capulin, Conejos, Bountiful and Ortiz. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.

area.areaDesc: Alamosa; Conejos; Costilla; Rio Grande; Saguache
